𒉆 > 𒉅 𒐑 𒈬 NAM NUTILLU
𒉆 NAM- (abstract nomen prefix) 𓅓 ma- en- im- -ing -ence -ent -ness ност -nost -ment men 𓄣 𒉆 SIM sym- -ism ! 𒉆 SÍN "sin" 𒉆𒋳𒂵 SÍN-tag-ga Sündigen 𒉆 ˢʸNAM ᵈᵉNAM NAM name; omen "fate, destiny; will, testament" 𒉆 ˢʸNAM •number numero = sumero شماره šomâre : 𒉆 SIM समूह samūh ∑ Sammlung 𒉆𒐊 "group of 5" …
𒉆 SÍNAM < DYNAM δύνᵃᵐ in 𒉆𒀉𒅅 δύναμη dýnami "force" dynamicᵃˡ 𒉆 SÍNAM < DYNAM in 𒉆𒋳𒋳 damnation <> 𒉆 SÍN "sin" 𒉆 SÍNAM < DYNAM in 𒉆𒋻 demon, sickness 𒉆 SÍNAM < DYNAM 𓂧 𓌗 𓌳 𓀀 𓏥 | groups, classes | 𒉆 SÍN <> صِنْف ṣinf صنف senf синыф sinıf სინიჶი sinifi сынып synyp 种 zhǒng ຊະນິດ sa'nit genus class group specimen 𒉆 SIM šīm sym- in 𒉆𒁺 συμπεριφορά symperiforá "behavior" 𒉆 SÍN SIM syn- sym- < con com in 𒉆𒄭𒊓 companionship 𓐍 𓈖 𓌰 𓅓 𓋴 𓀙 𓀀 𒉆 SÍN SIM syn- sym- < con com in 𒉆𒂵𒆜 commerce 𒉆 SÍN in 𒉆𒍑𒆪 sin₂gala "singing" <> summen: 𒉆 SIM in 𒉆𒈜 ˢʸnamnar SIM-NAR 𓇖 śamar 𒍝𒈠𒊒 za-ma-ru zamár זַמָּר musicianship 𒉆 SIM in 𒉆𒌑𒅲 SIM-u₂-zug₄ schmutzig(keit) pollutedness 𒉆 SIM •swarm swallow 𒉆𒄷 𓋴 𓅨 𓂋 𒉆𒃲 ˢʸnam-gal greatness 𒉆 SÍN > -ness reverse in 𒉆𒃴 cleverness, skilfulness 𒉆 SIM 𒋛𒅎 si-im "smell, sniff" 𒉆 SÍN 𓋴 𓈖 𓂉 𓀁 @ snout noƒe 𓋴 𓌢 𓈖 𓂉 | snout | ϣⲁⲛⲧ šant 𒉆 SÍN šen سُنُونُو sunūnū #sinuntu šenaᵗmušen 𒉆𒄷 𒊺𒂗𒄷 še-en 𒊺𒈾𒄷 še-na 𒄷 mušen 𒉆 SÍN sankt in 𒉆𒋾 SÍN.TI 𓋴 𓋹 𓈖 𓐍 sankt 𒉆𒋾𒀧 "live" 𒉆 SIM < SLM in 𒉆𒄘 SIM-gu₂ zilm ظُلْم ẓulm "oppression" submission 𒉆 SÍN > SᵛL in 𒉆𒄷 swallow 𒉆 SÍN > SᵛL in 𒉆𒀴 𒉆𒀵 SLᵛ•arad slavery 𒉆 SÍN > SᵛL in 𒍏𒉆𒍝𒄣 SᵛL•za Schlüssel {Erz}syn-zacken urud ˢʸnam-za-qum "key" syn'doağa дӏоагӏа 𒉆 SÍN >> EN in 𒉆𒂵𒆭𒊏 entrance 𒉆 NAMˢ > -ness ? 𒉆 NAM -ing 𒉆𒅗𒊏 nam-gu₃-rah₂ crying 𒉆 NAM as 𔖣 𔓝 quote 𒉆𒄸𒁯 nam:hub₂dar "Hufe treten" running ? 𒉆 ˢʸNAM- ʿyun in -ություն -utʿyun -tion -tum

𒉆 SIM ≈ 𓊗 •śimpti 𓊃 𓊪 𓊗 šimᵖti 𒋆 𒋾 "fate" @ 𒉆𒋾𒀧 <> 𓋴 𓋹 𓈖 𓐍

𒉆 NAM | man in 𒉆 NAM- man-of… …-man craftman(ship) 𒉆 man in 𒉆𒆗 nam-ĝuruš ˢʸnamĝuruš manliness 𒉆 man in 𒌋𒌋 Amun king in 𒉆𒂗 nam-en ˢʸnamen syn-amun shar-amen the office of en-priest; kingship 𒉆 man in 𒌋𒌋 Amun 𒉆𒉺𒋼𒋛 ˢʸnamensik mensik > malik ? 𒉆 man in 𒉆𒃞 nam-men (GA₂×ME+EN) ˢʸnammen lordship 𒉆 man in 𒉆𒍑 nam-nita ˢʸnamnita manhood 𒉆 men ≈ 𓏠 𓈖 in 𒉆𒀳 NAM… ñemitỹ noma 农 nóng 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 𓀸 ⲙⲉⲛⲧⲟⲩⲱⲓ mentouōi "farming" 𒉆𒂟 nam-erin₂ field-working 𒉆 man ≈ moni in 𒉆𒉺𒈗 ĝarza₂mon ceremonija "craft, office" 𒉆 man ≈ mini in 𒉆𒊮𒌓 administration (somehow, maybe;) 𒉆 man ≈ min in 𒉆𒋗𒄩 memancing മീൻപിടിത്തം mīṉpiṭittaṁ men𓄣pesca "fishing" मत्स्य पालन 𒉆 man ≈ ment

Strong tendency of reanalysis

Strong tendency of right reverse reading amplified in 𒁲𒋛𒉆 δικαιοσύνη dikaiosúnē "righteousness" 𒉆𒋛𒁲

If 𒉆 nam is read phonetically and not just a grammatical marker it makes Sumerian decidedly unfamiliar ¬PIE If 𒉆 sim is read phonetically as sym- syn- it makes Sumerian decidedly familiar PIE

Both may be true: An unfamiliar Sumerian marker might have influenced a PIE prefix.

𒉆 nam phonetically as ablaut marker? 𒄊𒀴 šakan₆ حَاكِم ˢḥākim "governor" => 𒉆𒄊𒀴 nam-šakan₆ حُكْمِة hukmah "governorship"

𒉇 nam₂ √mens mind (fore)thought, plan(ning); understanding; instruction

𒉆 ≈ 𒀸𒁹𒌋𒁹𒀹𒑋 (𒀹𒑋 ≈ 𒐑 ≈ 𒊺 ) ≈ 𒋾 , 𒍣 napištu "life"

𒉆 ⋍ 𒊑 𒌋 𒊺 ri.v.š / š.v.ri ⇔ 𓂋 𓈖 ?

𒂗𒉆 #sanut senator 𒊺 ≈ 𒐑 in 𒉆 SIM SÍN šīm sym syn

𒉆 𒉅 ≈ 𒄷𒎕 🦗 𓆧 circada 𒎕 PIR₂ ≈ 𒂟 zirati ZÁLAG the locust

-ing
